posts.description: WHEN THERE IS NO TEMPLATE, Writing on Pixar’s INSIDE OUT — Medium
posts.extended: My first day working at Pixar was simultaneously one of the most thrilling and scary days of my life. I had not written for animation before — I was walking into a process that I knew nothing about. I was intimidated by the great storytellers working at Pixar (in every department).

posts.description: Thursday’s massive gravitational wave news was broken by a sheet cake (really) - The Washington Post
posts.extended: In case you live under a rock, there's been some huge news in the physics world: On Thursday, scientists finally confirmed long-swirling rumors that they'd detected gravitational waves for the first time. But we heard it first from a picture of a cake.

posts.description: Does anybody really smoke in combat? [Archive] - Straight Dope Message Board
posts.extended: View Full Version : Does anybody really smoke in combat? I've seen several where the instructor warns the recruits NOT to smoke because it will give them away. Not so much the smell of smoke as the lit tip eaqsily visible at night.

posts.description: This Is How Hillary Clinton Gets the Coverage She Wants
posts.extended: Hillary Clinton’s supporters often argue that mainstream political reporters are incapable of covering her positively—or even fairly.

posts.description: Can you be a feminist and like rough sex?
posts.extended: Slapping, choking, spitting — if a woman gets off on a little consensual degradation in the bedroom, does that make her less of a feminist?

posts.description: The most exciting company in media sells a card game » Nieman Journalism Lab
posts.extended: Cards Against Humanity will remain the most exciting company in media. I’m watching them experiment on Twitch and with podcasts and live events in a way that gets people excited, builds a fan base and community, and makes people more invested in their own communities.
